Known for their high-energy live shows, Post Sex Nachos delivers performances that are as fun as they are musically tight. They’ve toured extensively across the U.S., bringing their infectious stage presence to small clubs, college towns, and festival stages alike. Their concerts often blur the line between performance and party, inviting audiences to dance, sing, and fully engage. What sets Post Sex Nachos apart is their ability to make music that is both technically sharp and joyfully unpretentious. With each release and every show, they continue to carve out a space in the indie scene that is uniquely theirs—equal parts groove, heart, and chaos.
Genres: Indie Rock, Funk, Pop, Jazz, Dance-Rock

Description: Washed Out is the musical project of Ernest Weatherly Greene Jr., an American singer, songwriter, and producer born on October 3, 1982, in Perry, Georgia. He is widely recognized as one of the key pioneers of the chillwave movement, a genre known for its dreamy textures, retro synths, and nostalgic atmosphere. Washed Out's music blends elements of synth-pop, dream pop, ambient, and lo-fi, creating immersive sonic landscapes that have become synonymous with the chillwave aesthetic. After completing a degree in library and information science, Greene returned to his hometown and began making music in his bedroom studio. Influenced by 1980s synth-pop, hip-hop, and electronic ambient music, he released two EPs in 2009, "High Times" and "Life of Leisure," which quickly garnered attention online. The track "Feel It All Around" from "Life of Leisure" became an underground hit and helped define the chillwave sound. Its dreamy atmosphere and looping vocals captured a feeling of sun-soaked nostalgia and went on to be widely recognized as a genre touchstone. In 2011, Washed Out released his debut full-length album, "Within and Without," expanding on the sound of his earlier work with more polished production and a cohesive, intimate tone. This was followed by "Paracosm" in 2013, an album that introduced more organic instrumentation and a lush, colorful palette of sounds. In 2017, he released "Mister Mellow," a visual album that explored themes of monotony, anxiety, and disconnection through a combination of downtempo beats and sample-heavy production. His fourth album, "Purple Noon," arrived in 2020, offering a smoother, more romantic sonic landscape influenced by Mediterranean pop and Balearic house. In 2024, Washed Out released "Notes from a Quiet Life," an introspective record inspired by his time living in rural Georgia. The album marked a shift in approach, featuring cleaner vocals, stripped-down arrangements, and a greater emphasis on songwriting. It reflected a more grounded and reflective version of his sound, while still retaining the dreamy emotional core that defines his music. Throughout his career, Washed Out has remained a defining voice in the world of ambient-leaning pop and electronic music. His ability to evoke emotion through texture and tone has earned him a dedicated following, and his influence continues to be felt across a generation of artists working at the intersection of nostalgia and futurism.
Genres: Chillwave, Synth-pop, Dream Pop, Ambient, Lo-fi

Description: Levity, an electronic trio born out of the creative collision between Chicago’s John Hauldren, Los Angeles’s PJ Carberry, and Minnesota’s Josh Tarum, has made waves in the music scene with a sound that effortlessly blends upbeat drums, atmospheric synths, and infectious melodies. Emerging with a fresh energy, their music has captivated listeners worldwide, accumulating over 3 million streams across platforms. Formed with a shared vision of producing electrifying soundscapes that invite listeners to escape reality, Levity’s tracks push the boundaries of electronic music while remaining accessible. Known for their invigorating live performances, the trio has garnered a reputation for engaging the crowd, creating an immersive experience that goes beyond just the music. Their performances are a journey, one that invites fans into their world of euphoria, rhythm, and vibrancy. Levity’s versatility has caught the attention of some of the biggest names in music, with the trio landing official remixes for artists such as Tinashe, Louis The Child, Quinn XCII, Chelsea Cutler, and Silent Child. These collaborations helped to expand their reach and solidify their reputation as a go-to creative force in the electronic scene. As Levity continues to grow and evolve, their ever-expanding fanbase is eagerly anticipating the next chapter in their musical journey. With a distinctive sound and undeniable presence, Levity is undeniably one to watch.

Zingara, born Gabrielle Mirabile on September 13, 1998, in Maryland, has rapidly made a name for herself as a dynamic force in the world of bass music. Initially encouraged by a friend to explore music professionally, Zingara’s journey began in 2017, when she pivoted from videography to DJing, performing in local venues around Towson, Maryland. This transition marked the beginning of a creative evolution that would see her become a prominent figure in the bass music scene. Her unique sound—intertwining deep bass, spirituality, and personal experiences—came to life in her 2022 debut EP Mind & Body, which showcased her ability to blend genre-defying elements with emotive storytelling. Zingara’s music is not only an auditory experience but also a reflection of her personal growth and the profound connections she has cultivated with her listeners. Her performances, which have included sets alongside artists like Subtronics, Level Up, and Slander, have cemented her status as a rising star in the bass music world. Her trajectory has been nothing short of impressive, performing at festivals like Big Dub Festival and continuing to share her evolving sound across platforms such as Spotify and SoundCloud. Zingara’s work is as much about the journey as it is about the sound, embodying the spiritual and personal elements that have shaped her path. As she continues to push boundaries and evolve, Zingara stands out as an artist who is not only shaping the bass music landscape but also connecting with her audience on a deeply authentic level.

DJ Python is an innovative electronic music producer and DJ known for his cutting-edge blend of technology and sound. Raised in a city that thrived on both urban culture and digital creativity, he found a unique way to merge his passion for programming with his love for music. His moniker, DJ Python, reflects his deep connection to the digital world, where intricate algorithms and experimental sounds collide. From his early days experimenting with home-built synthesizers and coding software for live performance, DJ Python developed a distinctive style that defies traditional genre boundaries. What began as a hobby in his college dorm transformed into a serious pursuit as he started performing at underground venues and local festivals. His early work captured the imagination of tech-savvy music fans, setting him apart as an artist who uses technology to push sonic limits. Musically, DJ Python blends elements of techno, glitch, ambient, and experimental electronica. His sets are characterized by complex, layered rhythms, unpredictable transitions, and a deep, immersive atmosphere that invites audiences to explore new sonic landscapes. Known for his meticulous attention to detail, he often programs and customizes his equipment to create a unique live experience that is both dynamic and thoughtfully crafted. On stage, DJ Python is celebrated for his ability to transform a conventional DJ set into an interactive journey. His performances often incorporate live coding, real-time audio manipulation, and visual elements that respond to the music, creating a multisensory experience. This innovative approach has earned him a reputation as a pioneer among a new generation of DJs, merging the roles of musician, programmer, and performance artist. Constantly evolving and experimenting with new technologies, DJ Python continues to push the boundaries of electronic music. Whether performing at intimate club nights or large-scale festivals, his commitment to sonic exploration and creative expression resonates with diverse audiences, cementing his status as a transformative force in the world of digital music.
Genres: Techno, Experimental Electronica, Glitch, Ambient, Digital Bass

Description: Airrica is a dynamic DJ and producer known for her genre-blending sets that fuse house, techno, acid, and trance. Her music is defined by high energy, playful rhythms, and an instinctive ability to keep dancefloors engaged and moving. Whether behind the decks at a packed club or performing at large-scale festivals, Airrica delivers sets that are bold, fun, and unpredictable. Originally from the United States, Airrica began her musical journey through a deep love for discovering and sharing music. Starting with burning CDs for friends and exploring a wide range of sounds, she developed an eclectic taste early on. Her entry into electronic music was shaped by self-guided exploration and a strong curiosity for underground sounds, which would go on to influence her distinct style as a performer and producer. Her DJ career began in Los Angeles, where she gained traction playing in lounges and underground parties. A pivotal move to Tulum helped solidify her as a rising force in the global scene—holding down a residency at IT Tulum, where she played several nights a week. This period allowed her to refine her technique, experiment with genre shifts, and build a strong foundation for her international rise. As a producer, Airrica debuted with the track "Defect," which featured glitchy vocal loops and bouncy, left-field grooves. Her collaborative EP "International Confusion" with producer Ashee highlighted her ability to craft music that is both playful and club-ready. Known for incorporating sassy vocal chops, rhythmic surprises, and acid-tinged undertones, her production style reflects the same adventurous spirit found in her DJ sets. Airrica has since played at major clubs and festivals around the world, including Hï Ibiza, Fabric London, and the Zurich Street Parade. Her performances are marked by infectious enthusiasm and a deep connection to the crowd. Drawing inspiration from artists like The Chemical Brothers, Tiga, and Fango, she continues to evolve her sound while staying grounded in her mission to make people dance and feel free.

Kamino is a Brooklyn-based DJ and producer whose sound blends house, techno, and melodic club music into a style that’s both emotionally rich and dancefloor-focused. Known for pairing percussive grooves with atmospheric textures and subtle melodies, Kamino crafts sets and productions that strike a balance between introspective and high energy. His music often carries a reflective, almost cinematic quality, while still maintaining a strong rhythmic drive. Having lived in London, Los Angeles, and Berlin before settling in New York, Kamino draws from a broad spectrum of global electronic scenes. His formative years in London’s underground rave culture during the early 2010s left a lasting impression on his approach to music—one rooted in community, late-night energy, and genre fluidity. These diverse cultural touchpoints continue to shape his eclectic and immersive sound. Kamino’s productions are known for their attention to detail and emotional depth. His tracks often combine deep basslines, intricate percussion, and layered synth work with minimalistic yet impactful vocal elements. His DJ sets mirror this production style, building narrative arcs through slow-burning progressions, genre crossovers, and thoughtful transitions. Whether opening a room or closing out a night, his sets are designed to evolve and keep listeners locked in. In addition to his solo output, Kamino has released music on respected electronic labels and contributed to collaborative compilations that showcase his range as a producer. His music has found support across a wide range of house and techno audiences, appreciated for its ability to move the body and the mind in equal measure. Kamino continues to evolve with each release, carving out a space that is as emotionally resonant as it is rhythmically powerful. With his roots in underground dance culture and his sights set on innovation, he stands out as a compelling voice in the modern electronic music landscape.
Genres: House, Techno, Melodic Techno, Deep House, Progressive House

Description: OMNOM is a Los Angeles-born DJ and producer known for his unconventional and genre-bending approach to house music. His sound is defined by quirky vocal samples, heavy basslines, and a playful yet razor-sharp production style that stands out in the crowded world of electronic music. Since bursting onto the scene with his breakout track “Fo Free” in 2018, OMNOM has carved out a unique niche with his eccentric, bass-driven take on tech house. Raised in California, OMNOM began producing music in the mid-2010s, quickly earning attention for his offbeat, groove-centric tracks. His early releases on labels like Dirtybird and Box of Cats showcased his ability to pair underground rhythms with tongue-in-cheek vocal work and unexpected arrangements. His music gained traction across festival stages and club circuits, earning support from a wide range of artists who appreciated his bold, left-of-center style. In 2023, OMNOM joined forces with Australian producer Odd Mob to release “Losing Control,” a standout track that topped dance music charts and introduced both artists to a broader global audience. The success of that collaboration led to the creation of their joint project, HYPERBEAM, which debuted with a highly anticipated live performance at EDC Las Vegas in 2024. Their EP “The Unexplained” continued to push the limits of house music, infusing it with cinematic flair, heavy low-end, and unpredictable sonic turns. Outside of the studio, OMNOM is known for delivering high-energy, off-the-wall DJ sets that balance precision with personality. He has played at major festivals including EDC Las Vegas, Electric Forest, and Beyond Wonderland, where his sets have earned a reputation for blending the weird and the danceable. His crowd engagement, eclectic track selections, and ability to build tension and release on the fly have made him a fan favorite in the live circuit. In 2019, OMNOM launched his own party brand, DESPERATE HOUSEVIBES, a platform aimed at promoting inclusivity and experimentation within house music. The project has grown into a celebration of forward-thinking dance culture, featuring both emerging and established artists who share a vision for pushing the genre beyond its boundaries.
Genres: House, Bass House, Tech House, Experimental Club

Description: AYYBO is a rising electronic music producer and DJ known for his dark, groove-heavy sound that blends tech house with cinematic textures and funk-inspired rhythms. Hailing from Southern California, AYYBO (pronounced "ay-bo") has quickly built a reputation for crafting bass-driven tracks that bring a fresh edge to the tech house landscape. His music is characterized by hypnotic beats, distorted vocals, and a minimalist yet bold approach to production. AYYBO first gained attention in 2022 with the breakout single “Hypnosis,” a track that showcased his signature blend of shadowy atmosphere and head-nodding groove. The song quickly made waves across streaming platforms and dancefloors alike, putting him on the radar of fans and industry tastemakers. Its success helped launch his career and solidified his sound—equal parts mysterious, funky, and hard-hitting. Following the momentum of his early releases, AYYBO continued to deliver a steady stream of original tracks and remixes that pushed his sound further. Songs like “Move Like This” and “New Dance” demonstrated his ability to merge catchy vocal chops with deep, pulsing basslines and rhythmic swing. His production style often blurs the lines between club-ready bangers and cinematic compositions, making his tracks as suitable for headphones as they are for peak-time sets. AYYBO’s live performances amplify the immersive quality of his music. His DJ sets are dark, energetic, and deeply rhythmic, often weaving between tech house, minimal, electro, and breaks. He brings a theatrical flair to his stage presence, often performing with custom visuals and lighting that reflect the noir-like tone of his sound. Whether in clubs or on festival stages, his performances leave a lasting impression through their combination of tension, groove, and futuristic atmosphere. As his profile continues to grow, AYYBO stands out as an artist with a fully realized aesthetic and a clear vision. With a sound that merges underground grit with cinematic polish, he continues to push the boundaries of tech house while forging a distinct identity in the broader electronic music world.
Genres: Tech House, Minimal, Electro, Funk-Inspired House, Cinematic Electronic

Description: it’s murph is a genre-blurring DJ and producer who has rapidly gained attention for his gritty, dancefloor-ready sound that combines elements of indie sleaze, electro house, and alternative dance. Based in Los Angeles, it’s murph channels a raw, nostalgic energy into his music, often evoking the spirit of 2000s bloghouse, warehouse rave culture, and underground indie aesthetics. His sound is high-octane, bass-forward, and infused with distorted vocals, punchy drums, and melodic synth textures. The project first broke out with the viral single “Food for the Soul,” which captured audiences with its pulsating groove and emotionally charged atmosphere. The track showcased murph’s knack for blending dark, moody production with accessible, hook-laden songwriting. It quickly became a favorite across festival circuits and online playlists, helping define a wave of new artists leaning into a gritty, analog-inspired electronic sound. Building on that success, it’s murph has continued to release singles that reflect a wide range of influences—from the sweat-soaked dance-punk of early 2000s indie rock to the sleek intensity of modern tech house. His music often plays with contrast, pairing warm analog synths with crunchy textures and melancholic vocal samples. Each release feels like a throwback and a step forward, bridging the gap between nostalgia and innovation. On stage, it’s murph brings a visceral energy to his DJ sets. He’s known for seamlessly mixing club bangers with left-field edits and unreleased material, creating a sense of unpredictability and momentum. His sets are built for late-night crowds and underground rooms, designed to provoke movement, emotion, and release. Whether playing a high-profile festival or a sweatbox club, he delivers with authenticity and edge. As the it’s murph project continues to grow, he remains focused on building a sonic identity that feels personal yet universally cathartic. His music captures the feeling of youth in flux—grimy, euphoric, chaotic, and real—and positions him as a standout in a new wave of artists reshaping the sound of modern dance music.
